required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of a Middle School Comprehensive Sexual Health Media Literacy Education Program
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Control Trial Efficacy Study of a Comprehensive Sexual Health Media Literacy Education Program for Middle School Students

collaborator.agency: Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to conduct a randomized controlled trial of a media literacy education program for middle school students with the goal of enhancing decision-making skills to prevent early and risky sexual behavior and teen pregnancy, and encourage healthy relationships.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in self-reported sexual activity assessed via questionnaire.
Change in self-reported sexual activity assessed via questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in self-reported intentions to engage in sexual activity assessed via questionnaire.

arm_group.description: 10-lesson middle school, comprehensive sexual health program developed based upon the Message Interpretation Processing model designed to increase critical thinking skills about media messages and reduce risky sexual behaviors.

intervention.description: 10-lesson middle school, comprehensive sexual health media literacy education program. Each lesson take approximately 50 minutes to teach and will be taught every school day for 2 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Must be able to read and write in English
Exclusion Criteria:
